intro: Psychotria microgrammata, commonly known as the small-stippled psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with distinctive dark green veins. It produces small, white to pale green flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Although not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphological features and potential ecological significance.
